  "title": "Female Cashier Supervisor",
  "description": "Cedarose HR Consult is a company focused on HR Consulting, Recruitment and other HR Services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Cashier Supervisor
Job Location:&nbsp;Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Objectives


	The position objective of a Cashier Supervisor is to ensure that all cashiers are functioning efficiently and effectively, ensure that Cashiers properly cost items selected by customers are monetarily valued and payments are received.
	The job requires a high level of customer interaction and people management abilities hence, Cashiers Supervisors should have impeccable customer service, leadership and communication skills.


Responsibilities


	Have a good working knowledge of Cashiers&#39; operations.
	Training and evaluating of newly employed Cashiers.
	Structuring duty roster for all Cashiers in line with the requirements of operations.
	Reiterating Cashiers&#39; operational guidelines to all Cashiers and ensure strict compliance.
	Assist Cashiers in the reprinting of receipts either from the POS terminals or directly from the system when printing errors occur.
	Ensure all cash points are kept tidy and organized before, during and after shifts.
	Ensure that Cashiers are properly dressed depicting morals and the organizational standard.
	Assist Floor Managers in product swap and refund process.
	Maintain all POS machines and report POS machine errors to the Branch Manager. Also liaise with bank agents to supply POS papers to avoid stock-out.
	Take stock of carrier bags, to ensure it is replenished as at when due and avoid stock out.
	Review all Cashiers&rsquo; applications for leave /shift swap to ensure it does not disrupt operations.
	Registration of customers under the loyalty scheme and assist customers in redeeming loyalty points
	Assist customers in making payments for items purchased using company&rsquo;s vouchers.
	Respond to Cashiers&rsquo; request for price checks and rectify price disparities with the inventory unit.
	Assist Cashiers in removing used shopping baskets and carts from the cash point and rearranging it.
	Assist Cashiers to delete items from the system before they sell out to customers when as operation demands.
	Consider peak business times and manage crowd to ensure no Cashier at the cashpoint is free while others are crowded with customers.
	Other duties as may be assigned to you by Management.


Requirements


	Educational Qualification (HND / B.Sc / M.Sc)
	Possess a minimum of Six (6) years of experience working in a retail environment, ideally must have a minimum of three (3) years in a supervisory role.
	Customer service-oriented with in-depth knowledge of business management processes.
	Preferred candidate must be a female
	Preferred candidate must be resident around Oshodi, Isolo or Mushin LGA of Lagos State.
	Must have completed the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) program or possess exemption letter
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be computer literate and able to work using Microsoft packages.
	Should possess excellent leadership skills and be able to lead a functional and productive team.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 Monthly.

Method of Application

title: Job Vacancies at Voltaire Lifestyle Services Limited
content:
Voltaire Lifestyle Services Limited are the owners of GAIA AFRICA Club and Gaby Lagos, luzury brands, situated in Victoria Island in Lagos State. It is a hospitality Company with a luxury restaurant, a private business club house and event management.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Internal Control / Audit Officer

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As our Internal Control/Audit Officer, you will conduct audits, risk assessments, and internal controls reviews across our operations.
	Your goal will be to identify areas for improvement, ensure adherence to policies and procedures, and mitigate risks.


Responsibilities


	Conduct Internal audits across our operations, including front office, food and beverage, housekeeping, events, administrative and finance.
	Assess and evaluate internal controls, risk management, and governance processes
	Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations for process enhancements
	Develop and implement audit plans, procedures, and tools specific to the hospitality sector
	Collaborate with the management to implement audit recommendations and monitor progress
	Stay up-to-date with industry best practices, regulatory requirements, and hospitality and events industry standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Hospitality Management, or related field
	Professional certification (ACCA, ICAN, ICA)
	7+ years of internal audit and control experience in the hospitality sector
	Strong knowledge of internal audit principles, risk management, and internal controls in a hospitality setting
	Familiarity with hospitality industry standards and regulations
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Application Closing Date: 24th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Applications and CVs to: careers@gaiaafricaclub.com with the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: If you are a detail-oriented and analytical professional with hospitality experience looking to join a dynamic team.

 

 

2.) Line Chef (Dining)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Line Chef with fine dining expertise to prepare and cook dishes to the highest standards.
	You will work closely with our Head Chef to maintain our reputation for exceptional food quality, presentation, and consistency.


Responsibilities


	Prepare and cook dishes according to receipes, portion sizes, and presentation standards
	Maintain a clean, organized, and safe kitchen environment
	Collaborate with the Head Chef and other kitchen staff to ensure seamless service
	Implement new recipes and menu ideas
	Manage inventory, minimize waste, and optimize kitchen resources
	Train and mentor junior staff members


Requirements


	Culinary Degree or equivalent certification
	3+ years of fine dining experience as a Line Chef or equivalent
	Knowledge of international cuisines (e.g English, French, Italian, Asian, Mexican)
	Strong knife skills and knowledge of various cooking techniques
	Excellent presentation and plating skills
	Ability to work under pressure and maintain quality standards
	Strong communication and teamwork skills
	Familiarity and ability to adhere to kitchen safety protocols.


Application Closing Date: 28th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Applications and CVs to: careers@gaiaafricaclub.com with the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	If you are a skilled and passionate Line Chef looking to join a dynamic team, apply
	We can't wait to taste your creations!


 

 

3.) Pastry Chef (Fine Dining)

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a skilled Pastry Chef to join our team, bringing creativity, precision, and passion to our desserts and pastries.
	As our Pastry Chef, you will be responsible for creating exquisite desserts, pastries, and breads that exceed our guests' expectations.
	You will work closely with the Head Chef to develop innovative recipes, manage our pastry section, and maintain the highest standards of quality and presentation.


Job Responsibilities


	Design and create visually stunning and uniquedesserts, pastries, and breads
	Develop and implement new recipes and menu ideas
	Plan production to faciliate daily requirements
	Supervise and coordinate all pastry and dessert preparation and presentation
	Manage pastry inventory, minimize waste, and optimize resources
	Train and mentor junior pastry staff members
	Maintain a clean, organized, and safe pastry kitchenenvironment
	Collaborate with the culinary team to ensure seamless service.


Minimum Requirements


	Culinary degree or equivalent certification in pastry arts
	A minimum of 5 years of fine dining experience as a Pastry Chef de Partie or Pastry Chef
	Knowledge of international pastry traditions (e.g. English, French, Italian, Asian, Mexican)
	Strong abilities and knowledge of pastry techniques, ingredients, and presentation styles
	Excellent creativity, attention to detail, and time management skills
	Ability to work under pressure and on a variety of shifts, including weekends.
	Strong communicator and team player.


Application Closing Date: 28th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Applications and CVs to: careers@gaiaafricaclub.com with the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We look forward to indulging in your creations!
